The Y position of the block to be placed.
The Z position of the block to be placed.
The face of the base block (determines which side of the base block the new one gets placed.)

member.exception: Thrown when the user lacks the trust level necessary for this.

member.remarks: This function requires trust or creative mode. If you build block on a chest without sneaking it will open the chest.
member.exception: Thrown when the user lacks the trust level necessary for this.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Entities.LocalPlayer.BreakBlock(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,OnixRuntime.Api.World.BlockFace,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Vec3)
member.summary: Tries to break a block. If this fails you will need to wait for the next tick before you can try another or continue destroying the same one.
member.param: The X position of the block to be broken.
The Y position of the block to be broken.
The Z position of the block to be broken.
The face of the block being broken.
Where the raycast would have hit the block in world coordinates.
member.returns: True if the block was destroyed.
member.remarks: You should call this function on the same block often since if you are in survival it will take time. This function requires trust or creative mode.
member.exception: Thrown when the user lacks the trust level necessary for this.
Thrown when you call this twice in the same tick without having broken the block last time.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Entities.CommandPermissionLevel.Owner
member.summary: Not too sure what this gives you extra, might be things like /allowlist, /stop.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Entities.CommandPermissionLevel.Internal
member.summary: I'm guessing this might be for the console.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Entities.PlayerPermissionLevel

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Entities.PlayerPermissionLevel.Visitor
member.summary: you can't do anything, you can't break blocks, interact with things, punch anything. You can type in chat and look around.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Entities.PlayerPermissionLevel.Member
member.summary: The normal permissions, no commands.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Entities.PlayerPermissionLevel.Operator
member.summary: You can run commands, change some world related options.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Entities.PlayerPermissionLevel.Custom
member.summary: You can be anything the person setting your permissions want. You are at their mercy regarding what they will decide to do with you.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventLocalServerWorld.OnBlockChangedDelegate
member.summary: Delegate that is invoked whenever a block in the world changes. Provides context about the region, position, old and new blocks, as well as how the change should be propagated and rendered.
member.param: The of the block that was modified.
The instance that previously occupied the position.
The instance that replaced the old block.
The layer, there are two layers. 0 is the main layer, 1 is generally used for waterlogging and things snow layers merging with some plants.
A flag that specifies how the update should be handled, such as updating neighbors, notifying the network, skipping graphics updates, or forcing priority updates.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventGame.OnUriInvokedRawDelegate
member.summary: The raw uri that was invoked e.g. "minecraft://openServersTab" When implementing your own uri handlers you should use .

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventGame.UriInvokedRaw
member.summary: The raw uri that was invoked e.g. "minecraft://openServersTab" When implementing your own uri handlers you should use .

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventGame.OnUriInvokedDelegate
member.summary: Called when a URI is invoked. specific to plugins. Not logic safe. The plugin uri that was invoked, the format goes as follows. minecraft://plugin.onixclient.com/{verb}?{key}={value}&{myKey}={myValue} You should use this whenever possible to make it clear it's for plugins and avoid conflicts if you're implementing custom ones.
member.param: The verb that was invoked. what goes after minecraft://verb/
The key-value parameters that were passed to the URI.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventGame.UriInvoked
member.summary: Called when a URI is invoked. specific to plugins. Not logic safe. The plugin uri that was invoked, the format goes as follows. minecraft://plugin.onixclient.com/{verb}?{key}={value}&{myKey}={myValue} You should use this whenever possible to make it clear it's for plugins and avoid conflicts if you're implementing custom ones.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventGui.OnContainerScreenHoverTextRequestedDelegate
member.summary: Represents a method that is called to retrieve the hover text for a container screen when an item is hovered over. You can change or replace the text however you want, return the text that will be shown to the user. If you have no changes to make, you should return DO NOT USE or unless you set vanilla to true. Otherwise, you will get infinite recursion.
member.param: The representing the item being hovered over. This parameter cannot be .
The current text of the item, changed by the ones who got it before you.
member.returns: A that will be put as is in the hover text. If you don't wish to modify the text, return

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventGui.ContainerScreenHoverTextRequested
member.summary: Occurs when the user hovers over an item in a container screen and the game requests the hover text to show. Technically it could happen at any time if a plugin or the client requests it in a different context but oh well, that's not an issue. DO NOT USE or unless you set vanilla to true. Otherwise, you will get infinite recursion.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRenderingNative
member.summary: Native event handler class for rendering events. Handles interop callbacks from the native runtime.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering
member.summary: Provides rendering-related events (world, HUD, screen rendering, 2D/Direct2D hooks). Subscribe to the events to receive renderer objects and timing deltas. Handlers are invoked with an appropriate renderer instance depending on the current rendering backend.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.OnWorldRenderDelegate
member.summary: Called when the world (3D) should be rendered. Logic-safe: game state and entities are available.
member.param: The time delta since the last frame.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.WorldRender
member.summary: Occurs when the world (3D) should be rendered. Handlers receive a RendererWorld and the frame delta.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RaiseOnWorldRender(System.Single)
member.summary: Raises the WorldRender event. Internal; called by native interop. Ensures renderer state is properly reset before and after invoking handlers.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.OnHudRenderDelegate
member.summary: Called when HUD should be rendered via the game's renderer. Logic-safe: game state and entities are available.
member.param: The time delta since the last frame.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.OnHudRender2DDelegate
member.summary: This event is called when on hud, hide hud is false and there is no client UI screen opened. This will be called from the user's preferred 2D renderer. This may or may not be a logic callback so don't access game state, entities, etc.
member.param: The time delta since the last frame.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.HudRenderGame
member.summary: Called when HUD should be rendered via the game's renderer. Logic-safe: game state and entities are available.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.HudRender
member.summary: This event is called when on hud, hide hud is false and there is no client UI screen opened. This will be called from the user's preferred 2D renderer. This may or may not be a logic callback so don't access game state, entities, etc.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RaiseOnHudRender(System.Single)
member.summary: Internal: raises HUD render events and forwards to 2D HUD rendering when appropriate.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RaiseOnHud2DRender(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererCommon2D,System.Single)
member.summary: Internal: raises 2D HUD render callbacks with the provided common 2D renderer.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.OnRenderScreenDelegate
member.summary: This event is called all the time. (always logic-safe) This is a logic callback so you can access game state, entities, etc.
member.param: The time delta since the last frame.
The name of the screen being rendered.
Whether the UI is for the client.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.OnRenderScreen2DDelegate
member.summary: This event is called all the time. You should avoid this if gives you what you need. This will be called from the user's preferred 2D renderer. This may or may not be a logic callback so don't access game state, entities, etc. There is no PreRenderScreen2D event, because depending on the renderer, pre means different things. You can handle this case manually by checking the different pre events and .
member.param: The time delta since the last frame.
The name of the screen being rendered.
Whether the UI is for the client.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RenderScreenGame
member.summary: This event is called all the time. (always logic-safe) This is a logic callback so you can access game state, entities, etc.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RenderScreen
member.summary: This event is called all the time. You should avoid this if gives you what you need. This will be called from the user's preferred 2D renderer. This may or may not be a logic callback so don't access game state, entities, etc. There is no PreRenderScreen2D event, because depending on the renderer, pre means different things. You can handle this case manually by checking the different pre events and .

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RaiseOnRenderScreen(System.Single,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal: called by native interop to raise screen render events. Also triggers HUD rendering if appropriate.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RaiseOnRenderScreen2D(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererCommon2D,System.Single,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal: raises 2D render callbacks for a screen.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.OnPreRenderScreenDelegate
member.summary: Delegate for the game's rendering callbacks (always logic-safe).
member.param: The time delta since the last frame.
The name of the screen being rendered.
Whether the UI is for the client.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.PreRenderScreenGame
member.summary: This event is called all the time. The Pre is before the client AND game's screens are rendered. You should avoid this if gives you what you need. debug_screen should always be there if you want to pick that one, otherwise you can ignore debug_screen and toast_screen to have just the main screen. This is a logic callback so you can access game state, entities, etc.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RaiseOnPreRenderScreen(System.Single,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal: raises pre-render screen events.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.OnRenderHudDirect2DDelegate
member.summary: This event is called when on hud, hide hud is false and there is no client UI screen opened. This will be called from the user's preferred 2D renderer. This will never be a logic callback so don't access game state, entities, etc.
member.param: The time delta since the last frame.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RenderHudDirect2D
member.summary: This event is called when on hud, hide hud is false and there is no client UI screen opened. This will be called from the user's preferred 2D renderer. This will never be a logic callback so don't access game state, entities, etc.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RaiseOnRenderHudDirect2D(System.Single)
member.summary: Internal: raises Direct2D HUD render callbacks.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.OnRenderScreenDirect2DDelegate
member.summary: This event is called all the time. You should avoid this if gives you what you need. This will never be a logic callback so don't access game state, entities, etc.
member.param: The time delta since the last frame.
The name of the screen being rendered.
Whether the UI is for the client.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RenderScreenDirect2D
member.summary: This event is called all the time. You should avoid this if gives you what you need. This will never be a logic callback so don't access game state, entities, etc.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RaiseOnRenderScreenDirect2D(System.Single,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal: raises Direct2D per-screen events and forwards to 2D screen rendering when appropriate.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.OnPreRenderScreenDirect2DDelegate
member.summary: This event is called all the time. The Pre is before the client's screens are rendered, not the game's. You should avoid this if gives you what you need. debug_screen should always be there if you want to pick that one, otherwise you can ignore debug_screen and toast_screen to have just the main screen. This will never be a logic callback so don't access game state, entities, etc.
member.param: The time delta since the last frame.
The name of the screen being rendered.
Whether the UI is for the client.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.PreRenderScreenDirect2D
member.summary: This event is called all the time. The Pre is before the client's screens are rendered, not the game's. You should avoid this if gives you what you need. debug_screen should always be there if you want to pick that one, otherwise you can ignore debug_screen and toast_screen to have just the main screen. This will never be a logic callback so don't access game state, entities, etc.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RaiseOnPreRenderScreenDirect2D(System.Single,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal: raises Direct2D pre-render callbacks and possibly HUD 2D rendering.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.ShouldHideScreenDelegate
member.summary: This is only for game screens, returning true will prevent that screen from rendering. Delegate used to determine whether a given game screen should be hidden. Return true to prevent rendering of that screen.
member.param: The name of the screen that just want to render itself.
member.returns: True if the screen should be hidden, false otherwise.

member.name: E:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.ShouldHideScreen
member.summary: This is only for game screens, returning true will prevent that screen from rendering.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventRendering.RaiseShouldNotRenderScreen(System.String)
member.summary: Internal: queries ShouldHideScreen handlers and returns true if any handler requested hiding the screen.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Events.OnixEventWorld.OnBlockChangedDelegate
member.summary: Delegate that is invoked whenever a block in the world changes. Provides context about the region, position, old and new blocks, as well as how the change should be propagated and rendered.
member.param: The of the block that was modified.
The instance that previously occupied the position.
The instance that replaced the old block.
The layer, there are two layers. 0 is the main layer, 1 is generally used for waterlogging and things snow layers merging with some plants.
A flag that specifies how the update should be handled, such as updating neighbors, notifying the network, skipping graphics updates, or forcing priority updates.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox
member.summary: Convenience class to have the basic functionality of a textbox without doing the hard work that comes with it. You're welcome. Set IsFocused to true to allow the user to start typing in it. don't forget that the user won't be able to use their keyboard until IsFocused is false! Use the Render function to render the textbox.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.TextSelection
member.summary: Class to represent a selection of text in an OnixTextbox.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.TextSelection.Begin
member.summary: The beginning index of the selection.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.TextSelection.End
member.summary: The end index of the selection.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.TextSelection.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new text selection.
member.param: The beginning index of the new selection.
The end index of the new selection.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.TextValidity
member.summary: Enum to represent the validity of the text inside an OnixTextbox.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.TextValidity.None
member.summary: The program has not checked the current text for validity. The outline will appear white.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.TextValidity.Invalid
member.summary: The program has checked the current text is an invalid input. This puts a red outline around the textbox.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.TextValidity.Valid
member.summary: The program has checked the current text is a valid input. This puts a green outline around the textbox.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.CursorVisibility
member.summary: Specifies the visibility state of the textbox cursor.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.CursorVisibility.BlinkingWhenFocused
member.summary: The cursor is visible and blinking when the textbox is focused.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.CursorVisibility.Normal
member.summary: The cursor is visible and blinking when the textbox is focused.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.CursorVisibility.Static
member.summary: The cursor is visible but not blinking.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.CursorVisibility.Hidden
member.summary: The cursor is not visible.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new OnixTextbox.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.Text
member.summary: The raw text inside the textbox.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.PlaceholderText
member.summary: The placeholder text that will show in light gray when the textbox is empty.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.DisplayText
member.summary: The text that should be displayed, this is mainly used for password mode.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.AsNumberInt
member.summary: Gets the text as an integer, use this instead of int.Parse() because it takes care of the AllowHex and anything else that might not exist yet.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.AsNumberLong
member.summary: Gets the text as an long, use this instead of long.Parse() because it takes care of the AllowHex and anything else that might not exist yet.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.AsNumberDouble
member.summary: Gets the text as a double, use this instead of double.Parse() because it takes care of the AllowHex and anything else that might not exist yet.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.AsNumberFloat
member.summary: Gets the text as a float, use this instead of float.Parse() because it takes care of the AllowHex and anything else that might not exist yet.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.AllowDecimal
member.summary: Property to allow or disallow decimal numbers e.g. 6.9

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.IsNumericOnly
member.summary: Property to make the textbox only accept numeric values.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.AllowHex
member.summary: Property to make the numeric textbox hexadecimal e.g. DEADBEEF

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.IsPassword
member.summary: Property to make the textbox a password field.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.MaxLength
member.summary: Property for the maximum amount of characters in the textbox.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.CursorIndex
member.summary: The index of the cursor in the textbox.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.IsFocused
member.summary: If the textbox is focused or not. If this is true the user will be able to type in it with no extra setup needed. don't FORGET TO SET IT BACK TO FALSE OTHERWISE THE USER WON'T BE ABLE TO USE THEIR KEYBOARD!

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.IsEmpty
member.summary: If the textbox is empty or not. Setting this to true will clear the textbox, false does nothing.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.HasNewText
member.summary: Will return true if the text is different from the last time this property was checked.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.HasConfirmedText
member.summary: Will return true once after the user has pressed enter.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.Validity
member.summary: The validity of the text inside the textbox. Setting it to Valid will make the outline green, setting it to Invalid will make the outline red. Having it to None will have the normal outline color.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.Selection
member.summary: The selection of text in the textbox or null.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.Clear
member.summary: Clears the textbox text/selection.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.Render(OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Rect,OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.CursorVisibility)
member.summary: Renders the textbox in the specified position using the onix theme.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.Render(OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Rect,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.ColorF,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.ColorF,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.ColorF,OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.OnixTextbox.CursorVisibility)
member.summary: Renders the textbox in the specified position using your own colors.

member.summary: Represents a memory address container that may own the memory it points to. It has a destructor that lets it decide which one it is. This is for single ownership.

member.summary: Indicates whether this instance has ownership of the memory it points to.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Sets the memory address and destructor function address.

member.summary: Finalizer for the class.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Internal.MightOwnMemoryAddressContainer.op_Equality(OnixRuntime.Api.Internal.MightOwnMemoryAddressContainer,OnixRuntime.Api.Internal.MightOwnMemoryAddressContainer)
member.summary: Compares two instances for equality.
member.returns: True if the instances are equal; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Compares two instances for inequality.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Internal.SharedMemoryAddressContainer
member.summary: Contains a shared memory address pointer for passing and owning shared memory with an unmanaged context.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Internal.SharedMemoryAddressContainer.PointerType
member.summary: Represents a shared memory address pointer for passing and owning shared memory with an unmanaged context.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Internal.SharedMemoryAddressContainer.PointerType.Shared
member.summary: A shared pointer reference. You share real ownership with others, or maybe you're the last thing keeping it alive. This object will not disappear until all references are released.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Internal.SharedMemoryAddressContainer.PointerType.Weak
member.summary: A weak reference to the object. This object might disappear leaving you lost and confused.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Internal.SharedMemoryAddressContainer.PointerType.Raw
member.summary: Just a raw pointer, YOLO!

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Internal.SharedMemoryAddressContainer.PointerType.Unique
member.summary: You own that object, it's all yours. You own it. Once you're done with it it's joever for it.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Internal.SharedMemoryAddressContainer.PointerType.Disposed
member.summary: The object has been disposed. You can no longer use it.

The other functions are fine but avoid reading from random threads/places if you don't own it. If you get it from the source every time it should be safe to read.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Items.ItemStack.GetHoverText(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the hover text for the item stack. The one when you put your mouse over the item in the inventory. DO NOT USE IN unless you set vanilla to true. Otherwise, you will get infinite recursion.
member.param: A value indicating whether to include the item's category in the hover text. to include the category; otherwise, .

A value indicating whether to format the hover text using vanilla formatting rules. to use vanilla formatting; otherwise, . Non-vanilla formatting means the client/a plugin can change it before you get the text.
member.returns: A string containing the hover text for the item stack. The content of the text depends on the specified parameters.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Items.ItemStack.GetHoverText(OnixRuntime.Api.World.RuntimeWorld,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the hover text for the item stack. The one when you put your mouse over the item in the inventory. DO NOT USE IN unless you set vanilla to true. Otherwise, you will get infinite recursion.
member.param: A value indicating whether to include the item's category in the hover text. to include the category; otherwise, .
The world in which you are getting the hover text, by default the client tries to guess so you can get away with not providing anything most of the time.

A value indicating whether to format the hover text using vanilla formatting rules. to use vanilla formatting; otherwise, . Non-vanilla formatting means the client/a plugin can change it before you get the text.
member.returns: A string containing the hover text for the item stack. The content of the text depends on the specified parameters.

member.summary: Adds a new enchantment or updates the level of an existing enchantment.
member.remarks: If the specified enchantment does not already exist, it will be added with the specified level. If it does exist, its level will be updated to the provided value.
member.param: The type of enchantment to add or update.
The level of the enchantment. Must be a positive integer. If the enchantment already exists, its level will be updated to this value.

member.summary: Tells you if this stack of items should have an enchantment overlay when rendered. This is useful because you save converting the whole NBT to read ench and it supports things like enchanted golden apples which don't have an ench tag.

member.returns: The texture coordinates of the icon as a object.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.TransformationMatrix.TranslateWorldPosition(OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Vec3)
member.summary: Returns a translation matrix for the given x, y, z values in the world. this function adds the inverted origin so you don't have to do it manually. Doing the subtraction before multiplying the matrix fixes the precision error that appear scarily quickly otherwise. To use this you would do all your normal matrix math at the origin as normal and position it by multiplying the result by this matrix.

member.summary: Returns a translation matrix for the given x, y, z values in the world. this function adds the inverted origin so you don't have to do it manually. Doing the subtraction before multiplying the matrix fixes the precision error that appear scarily quickly otherwise. To use this you would do all your normal matrix math at the origin as normal and position it by multiplying the result by this matrix.

member.summary: Gets the runtime world for the local player, or null if not available.

member.summary: Gets the current dimension if available.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings
member.summary: Provides access to Onix client-specific features such as notifications, tooltips, modules, and settings.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.OnNotificationClickedDelegate
member.summary: Invoked when a notification is clicked by the user. return true to dismiss the notification, false to keep it open.
member.returns: true to dismiss the notification, false to keep it open.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.Notify(System.String,System.String,System.Single,OnixRuntime.Api.ClientNotificationType,System.Boolean,OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.OnNotificationClickedDelegate)
member.summary: Shows a notification to the user. Note: For the , returning true will dismiss the notification, returning false will keep it open.
member.param: The duration in seconds for the notification.
Whether to mute the notification sound.
An optional delegate to invoke when the notification is clicked. Return true to dismiss the notification, false to keep it open.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.NotifyBanner(System.String,System.String,System.Single,System.Boolean,OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.OnNotificationClickedDelegate)
member.summary: Shows a banner notification to the user. Note: For the , returning true will dismiss the notification, returning false will keep it open.
member.param: The duration in seconds for the notification.
Whether to mute the notification sound.
An optional delegate to invoke when the notification is clicked. Return true to dismiss the notification, false to keep it open.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.NotifyTray(System.String,System.String,System.Single,System.Boolean,OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.OnNotificationClickedDelegate)
member.summary: Shows a tray notification to the user. Note: For the , returning true will dismiss the notification, returning false will keep it open.
member.param: The duration in seconds for the notification.
Whether to mute the notification sound.
An optional delegate to invoke when the notification is clicked. Return true to dismiss the notification, false to keep it open.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.SetTooltipText(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the tooltip text at the given point. You should only call this if the user's mouse is within the desired area of the tooltip. The tooltip will be displayed by the client based on the user's preferences. This has text wrapping support so you don't need to \n your text.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.SetTooltipText(System.String,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Rect)
member.summary: Sets the tooltip text at the given point. The tooltip will be displayed by the client based on the user's preferences. This has text wrapping support so you don't need to \n your text.
member.param: The area in which the tooltip should be shown if the mouse is inside it.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.OpenUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the specified URL in the user's browser.

member.summary: Opens the specified directory in the file explorer.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.OpenFile(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the specified file in the default application.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClientThings.ThemeV3
member.summary: Gets the onix client v3 user's theme. You can use this to design your plugin to match the user's theme and the rest of the client. You should cache this value if you use it more than once in the same function.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen
member.summary: Represents an in client screen that you can implement. This lets you do proper in-client ui without having to worry about the mods showing up on top.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.ScreenName
member.summary: The name of the screen.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new ClientScreen instance. This allows you to open it and it acts like other client screens. It hides the screen below it and the hud elements like fps counter.
member.param: The name of your script. Only one screen can have that name in this plugin.
If true, the background will be blurred for you.
If true, it will hide screens below it, the color picker is an example of a screen that is not full screen.
member.exception: When the name is already taken by another instance in this plugin.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.Position
member.summary: The position you should render the content of your screen at.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.Size
member.summary: The size of your screen. Try not to render past Position + Size!

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.RenderArea
member.summary: Your screen's render area, you should do all rendering within that rectangle.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.IsFullscreen
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the screen is in fullscreen mode. Fullscreen mode hides the screen below it and the hud elements like fps counter.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.ClickInput
member.summary: Gets the last click since the last time was called.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.ScrollCount
member.summary: How many scrolls have been made on this screen since the last time was called.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.HandleAllInputs
member.summary: Handles all inputs for this screen. This will reset the and values.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OnOpened
member.summary: Called when the screen is opened.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OnClosed
member.summary: Called when the screen has been requested to close, if you return true it will cancel the closing. This is for when you have submenus and want to close just those before closing the main screen.
member.returns: true to not close the screen.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.GetCloseAnimationDuration
member.summary: How long in seconds is this screen's close animation. Will switch to and and then call when the time is over.
member.returns: The duration in question.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OnCloseFinished
member.summary: Called when the screen is finished closing. If you use onix settings and know nothing below you uses settings, you should call here. base.OnCloseFinished(); will do that for you.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.ShouldPreventInputs
member.summary: Used to tell if the screen should prevent inputs from going to the game or screens below.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.ForceDirect2D
member.summary: Force the use of Direct2D for rendering and .

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OnGameWindowResized(OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Vec2)
member.summary: Called whenever the game's window is resized, allowing you to resize your screen or have custom resize logic.
member.param: The new size of the window.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OnInput(OnixRuntime.Api.Inputs.InputKey,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when there is a new input event happening on your screen. Returning true will prevent the screens and game below from receiving it.
member.param: If it was it getting clicked or not.
member.returns: true to mention you handled it and hide it from the screens and game below.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OnRenderWorld(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererWorld)
member.summary: Called when the world is being rendered.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OnRender(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererCommon2D)
member.summary: Called when you should render your screen. This could be RednererDirect2D or RendererGame, depending on user preference or

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OnRenderClosing(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererCommon2D)
member.summary: Called when you should render your screen's closing animation. This could be RednererDirect2D or RendererGame, depending on user preference or

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OnRenderGame(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererGame)
member.summary: Called when the game is being rendered and your screen is closing. This is useful for getting data from the game since may be Direct2D. You should use to actually render the content.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OnRenderGameClosing(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererGame)
member.summary: Called when the game is being rendered. This is useful for getting data from the game since may be Direct2D. You should use to actually render the content.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.OpenScreen
member.summary: Opens the screen now if it's not already opened.
member.returns: Whether the screen was opened or not.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientScreen.CloseScreen
member.summary: Closes the screen now if it's not already closed.
member.returns: Whether the screen was closed or not.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientThemeV3
member.summary: Represents the theme colors used by the Onix client (version 3).

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientThemeV3.Text
member.summary: Color used for primary text displayed in the UI. You can probably get away with reducing the opacity for secondary text.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientThemeV3.Blocked
member.summary: Color used for blocked/forbidden states (e.g. errors or unavailable items). Sometimes used to have a popup have more contrast/opacity over the background.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientThemeV3.Accent
member.summary: Accent color used to indicate enabled/primary controls and highlights.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientThemeV3.Disabled
member.summary: Color used for disabled UI elements. I think this is used once for the bool's switch background in the disabled state.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientThemeV3.Highlight
member.summary: Color used for highlighted elements or hover states. This is also what's used for the unfilled slider background.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientThemeV3.Outline
member.summary: Color used for outlines and borders around controls.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientThemeV3.WindowBackground
member.summary: Background color for windows or panels.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientThemeV3.Button
member.summary: Color used for some buttons in the UI. See for primary color usage. Which one is used is a bit inconsistent, often is used.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixClientThemeV3.Scrollbar
member.summary: Color used for scrollbars.

member.summary: A normal built in module that isn't rendering a visual ui element.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixModuleVisual.OnRender(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererCommon2D)
member.summary: Called everytime the module is rendered. If you're lazy just add a listener in You could call it yourself, just make sure to check to know when to call this on the Game(which you lost)'s renderer or the Direct2D renderer. This includes client UI, game UI, preview UI and whatever else the module will be asked to be rendered on. Which renderer you will get is based on use preference and . If you have set to true, you'll always get the Game's renderer. Otherwise, the default is the Direct2D renderer but the user could have disabled it, giving you the game's only. This callback will NEVER be logic, no touching gameplay objects. Gather that data elsewhere if you require it.
member.param: The 2D renderer used to draw the current state.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixModuleVisual.RenderDelegate
member.summary: Represents a render delegate for the visual module.
member.param: The 2D renderer used to draw the current state.
The time in seconds since the last render call.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixModuleVisual._renderDelegates
member.summary: Occurs when a render operation is triggered. This includes client UI, game UI, preview UI and whatever else the module will be asked to be rendered on. Which renderer you will get is based on use preference and . If you have set to true, you'll always get the Game's renderer. Otherwise, the default is the Direct2D renderer but the user could have disabled it, giving you the game's only.

member.summary: Occurs when a render operation is triggered.

member.summary: A boolean (true/false) setting.

member.summary: An integer number setting.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.Float
member.summary: A floating-point number setting.

member.summary: A keyboard/mouse/gamepad key binding setting.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.Vec2
member.summary: A 2D vector setting. (An x and y float slider.)

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.Color
member.summary: A color setting. This allows the user to enter a color.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.Textbox
member.summary: A text input setting. This is a textbox that allows the user to enter text.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.Enum
member.summary: An enumeration setting. A list of options to choose from that translate to an int.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.GamepadKeybind
member.summary: A collection of keybinds for gamepad input. don't have non gamepad keys in this setting.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.Air
member.summary: A setting that represents an empty space of changeable height.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.Info
member.summary: A setting that displays textual information to the user. Essentially a label.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.Button
member.summary: A button setting that can be clicked by the user.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.ModuleHeader
member.summary: A header for a module section. This should be the first setting in a module and is used internally to generalize rendering.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.Category
member.summary: A category setting for organizational purposes.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.LocalizedInfo
member.summary: A setting that displays localized text information to the user. Essentially a label.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType.Custom
member.summary: A custom setting type for specialized functionality. Note that values above 150 are also custom settings. You should use .IsCustom to check for a custom setting's presence.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingTypeExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for the OnixSettingType enumeration.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingTypeExtensions.IsVisual(OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixSettingType)
member.summary: Checks if the setting type is a visual only type. This means it does not store any persistent data. Custom settings are also included in that category.

member.summary: Whether the waypoint is visible in any way or not. This will hide the waypoint from the minimap, direction hud, text, beam, circle, etc. (Not implemented in minimap at this time)

member.summary: Whether the waypoint should be removed when the world is closed. This effectively just never saves the waypoint. Whatever causes the waypoint list to be loaded again will make this waypoint disappear (if this is true of course).

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.OnixWaypoint.ShowCircle
member.summary: Whether the waypoint should show a circle in the world. This is not implemented right now in the client. It will be part of a future waypoint update.

If you use an existing waypoint that has an ID, you do not need to call this method when is true. If making a lot of changes/updates, you should set that to false and call this method manually.

member.summary: Gets or sets the keybinds that are bound to this setting. Only gamepad inputs should be included. If you change the list, assign it back to apply the changes. This variant will call the on setting changed with the isInit flag set to true.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixClient.Settings.OnixSettingGamepadKeybind.Default
member.summary: Gets or sets the default keybinds that are bound to this setting. Only gamepad inputs should be included. If you change the list, assign it back to apply the changes.

member.summary: Adds basically text as a setting.

member.summary: Creates a new setting info.
member.param: The module to add this setting to or null.
The text that shows when you hover the setting.
The scale of the setting's text in the UI.
Gets called before rendering, you could use this to update the text before the user sees it, keep in mind it is a Direct2D thread calling this.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame
member.summary: Provides access to core Onix game features, including version, pack managers, chat, commands, and language code.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.Version
member.summary: Gets the Onix game version.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.PackManager
member.summary: The pack manager of the client, this is the one you will/should use most of the time. It includes global packs, world packs, treatment packs and whatever else is active!

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.PackManagerBehavior
member.summary: The pack manager, mainly for behavior packs like vanilla behavior packs. This is the client one so there won't be much in there.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.SendChatMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a chat message to the game.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.ExecuteCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Executes a command in the game.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.GetTranslatedMessage(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Gets a translated message from the game. This lets you get game text in the user's game language.
member.param: The translation key as found in the default pack's en_US.lang or any other lang file.
The parameters this key uses, like player names or things like that.
member.returns: The translated message or the same as what came in.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.GetTranslatedMessage(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Gets a translated message from the game. This lets you get game text in the user's game language.
member.param: The translation key as found in the default pack's en_US.lang or any other lang file.
The parameters this key uses, like player names or things like that.
member.returns: The translated message or the same as what came in.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.AudioEngine
member.summary: Gets the audio engine of the game. This allows you to play game sounds as well as stop them.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.LanguageCode
member.summary: Gets the current language code of the game.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.InvokeUri(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Invokes a URI internally with the specified verb and parameters. Verb may or may not be completely useless. You'll probably have to play around with it a little bit.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.OnixGame.Options
member.summary: The game's options. This lets you change the game's options, like the field of view or the perspective.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOptionType
member.summary: The type of game option.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOptionOwnerType
member.summary: The type of ownership for a game option.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOption
member.summary: Represents a configurable option within a game, providing functionality to change and retrieve option values.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOption.SaveName
member.summary: Gets the current save name of the option, those are the ones you will see in the game (which you lost)'s options.txt file. e.g. "gfx_field_of_view".

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOption.TelemetryPropertyName
member.summary: Some settings get sent for telemetry purposes, this is the name of that property in the json or something.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOption.DisplayNameTranslationKey
member.summary: The translation key for displaying that option. This is what you'll find as the key in the .lang file. e.g. "options.fov".

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOption.DisplayName
member.summary: The translated display name of the option, this is what you would see in the game's settings menu. e.g. "Fov".

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOption.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of this game option. You can also use inheritance to check the type, like if (option is GameOptionBool boolOption) { ... }.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOption.OwnerType
member.summary: The kind of owner this option has.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOption.Id
member.summary: The ID for this option, this is version specific and changes between versions. You should only use this if you know the ID for the version you're on right now. Don't assume that the ID will be the same in future versions, it might change so make sure you collected it from the option you want before you use it and never hardcode one in!

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether any game options are available.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOptions.OptionCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of game options. Note that some options are not ever created and therefore the amount of options you count when iterating through the list will differ.

member.summary: Gets an enumerable collection of all game options.

member.summary: Instantiates a of the correct derived type based on its underlying type.

member.returns: A strongly-typed instance.

member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through all game options.
member.returns: An enumerator of .

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOptions.FindById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to find a game option by its unique identifier. Note: You should NEVER hardcode an ID, always assume that the ID will change between each restart.
member.param: The ID of the option to find.
member.returns: The matching if found; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOptions.Find(System.Func{OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOption,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Finds the first game option that matches the specified predicate and gives it to you.
member.param: A function to test each option for a condition.
member.returns: The first matching , or null if none match.

member.param: The save name of the option.
member.returns: The matching if found; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Options.GameOptions.FindByTranslationKeyName(System.String)

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics
member.summary: Represents various information about a block's graphics. Notably it's texture and shape.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.BlockShapes
member.summary: The different shapes a block can have. There are always custom blocks that they added some time ago but for vanilla blocks, these are the shapes you will encounter.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.TextureItem
member.summary: Represents a block's texture, having both the carried and default textures. The carried textures is used for things like UI. Example: The carried grass texture is hardcoded green while the default one is grayscale.

member.summary: The default name of the texture.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.TextureItem.CarriedName
member.summary: The carried name, this is generally used in the UI, the carried grass texture is hardcoded green while the default one is grayscale.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.TextureItem.DefaultItem
member.summary: The default texture in the .

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.TextureItem.CarriedItem
member.summary: The carried texture in the . This is generally used in the UI, the carried grass texture is hardcoded green while the default one is grayscale.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.Block
member.summary: The block this is for.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.Shape
member.summary: Gets the shape of the block.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.BrightnessGamma
member.summary: No idea, it's here if you need it and know what it is. If you do know please contribute the documentation comment.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.Fancy
member.summary: If this is the fancy version of the block graphics.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.AllowSame
member.summary: If the same block can have multiple graphics (?)

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.VisualShape
member.summary: May be unused/unpopulated.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.TextureItems
member.summary: The textures used by this block. In most cases, you get 6 of those for each side of the block. has the indexes for each side.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.GetTextureDefaultVariations(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the default texture variations for a specified block face and block variant.
member.param: Generally, the face of the block for which the texture is being retrieved, mapped as you need to rotate blocks yourself.
The variant of the block, used to determine the specific texture to retrieve, like wood types. This may not always be just Data.
member.returns: An array of representing the default texture variations for the specified block face and variant.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.GetTextureDefaultVariation(OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.BlockPos,System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the texture UV coordinates for a specific block face and variant at the given world position.
member.param: The position of the block in the world.
Generally, the face of the block for which the texture is being retrieved, mapped as you need to rotate blocks yourself.
The variant of the block, used to determine the specific texture to retrieve, like wood types. This may not always be just Data.
member.returns: The representing the UV coordinates of the texture for the specified block face and variant.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.BlockGraphics.GetTextureCarriedVariations(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the default texture variations for a specified block face and block variant. Carried is generally used in the UI, the carried grass texture is hardcoded green while the default one is grayscale.
member.param: Generally, the face of the block for which the texture is being retrieved, mapped as you need to rotate blocks yourself.
The variant of the block, used to determine the specific texture to retrieve, like wood types. This may not always be just Data.
member.returns: An array of representing the default texture variations for the specified block face and variant.

member.summary: Retrieves the texture UV coordinates for a specific block face and variant at the given world position. Carried is generally used in the UI, the carried grass texture is hardcoded green while the default one is grayscale.
member.param: The position of the block in the world.
Generally, the face of the block for which the texture is being retrieved, mapped as you need to rotate blocks yourself.
The variant of the block, used to determine the specific texture to retrieve, like wood types. This may not always be just Data.
member.returns: The representing the UV coordinates of the texture for the specified block face and variant.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters
member.summary: Represents various rendering parameters for the state.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor for the material parameters. Defaults with everything to false except .

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.Linear
member.summary: Enables or disables linear filtering for the material, with this false, nearest neighbor will be used.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.Blending
member.summary: Enables or disables blending for the material, with this false, the material will be always opaque.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.AlphaTest
member.summary: Enables or disables alpha testing for the material, this will discard transparent pixels of a texture.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.NoDepthTest
member.summary: Enables or disables depth testing for the material, with this false, the material will not be rendered if it is behind another object that was also depth tested.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.NoDepthWrite
member.summary: Enables or disables depth writing for the material, with this false, the material will not write to the depth buffer, allowing other objects to be rendered on top of it even when they are below.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.DepthLessEqual
member.summary: Changes the depth test to be less than or equal instead of just less than, this will allow objects to be rendered on top of each other if they are at the same depth.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.Light
member.summary: Enables or disables lighting for the material, with this false, the material will not be affected by lights in the scene. Make sure FullBright isn't enabled in the client if you're trying to see that working.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.DisableCulling
member.summary: Enables or disables culling for the material, with this false, both faces of geometry will be rendered.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.InvertCulling
member.summary: When true, the front face of the geometry will be rendered as the back face.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.Gradient
member.summary: Allows the material to specify a vertex color.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.Uv
member.summary: Allows the material to specify UV coordinates for textures.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameters.IsCustom
member.summary: If the material is custom and does not utilize the parameters defined here.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameterType
member.summary: Represents the various parameters that can be configured for a game material. This enum is used for individual parameters, when you just want to toggle something on for a bit for example.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameterType.Linear
member.summary: Enables or disables linear filtering for the material, with this false, nearest neighbor will be used.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameterType.Blending
member.summary: Enables or disables blending for the material, with this false, the material will be always opaque.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameterType.AlphaTest
member.summary: Enables or disables alpha testing for the material, this will discard transparent pixels of a texture.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameterType.NoDepthTest
member.summary: Enables or disables depth testing for the material, with this false, the material will not be rendered if it is behind another object that was also depth tested.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameterType.NoDepthWrite
member.summary: Enables or disables depth writing for the material, with this false, the material will not write to the depth buffer, allowing other objects to be rendered on top of it even when they are below.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameterType.DepthLessEqual
member.summary: Changes the depth test to be less than or equal instead of just less than, this will allow objects to be rendered on top of each other if they are at the same depth.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameterType.Light
member.summary: Enables or disables lighting for the material, with this false, the material will not be affected by lights in the scene. Make sure FullBright isn't enabled in the client if you're trying to see that working.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameterType.DisableCulling
member.summary: Enables or disables culling for the material, with this false, both faces of geometry will be rendered.

member.name: F:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.GameMaterialParameterType.InvertCulling
member.summary: When true, the front face of the geometry will be rendered as the back face.

member.summary: Allows the material to specify a vertex color.

member.summary: Starts a new mesh builder session. Disposing the session will cause the mesh to be rendered. You should prefer the renderer's to this one since they will hand it to you in a more ready state based on its current parameters.
member.param: The texture that will be used when rendering.
The type of primitive the vertices will represent.
If true, applies a reverse origin offset if the renderer is 3D. This makes it visible in 3d space.
member.returns: The new session, don't forget to dispose it!

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer
member.summary: Helper class to render svg documents at varying sizes.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.VirtualBasePath
member.summary: This is the virtual base path used to identify the SVG image. It is used to construct the texture path for the SVG image. This allows you to group SVG images under a common path in the texture cache.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.VirtualFileName
member.summary: This is the virtual file name used to identify the SVG image. These things need a name, so we can upload them to the texture cache. The name should be unique for each SVG image, and it will be used to construct the texture path.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.PathProvider
member.summary: This function is used to get a virtual for the SVG image rendering at a specific size. The default implementation constructs a path based on the renderer's base path and file name, appending the size in the format "{width}x{height}.png". If you need a different path structure or want to use a different method to get the texture path, you can override this function. It will upload the image for that size under whatever you return here.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.SvgImageRenderer
member.summary: This function is used to render the SVG document into a raw image data. The default implementation uses the SvgDocument's Render method to create a RawImageData object. This will fill the whole image, stretching it if necessary. If you need more control over how it places the SVG into the image, you can override this function.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.SizeTransformer
member.summary: This function transforms the size given by the user when rendering the image into the size of the actual image data. The default implementation multiplies the size by the GUI scale factor, making it the same raw pixel size as the GUI. If you want to use the SVG renderer for other purposes, you can override this function to return a different size fitting your needs.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.RegenerationThreshold
member.summary: When rendering in non-static mode, this is the minimum size difference that will trigger a regeneration of the SVG image. This is used to avoid regenerating the image too often when the size changes too slightly. /// The default value is 64x64 pixels, meaning that the image will only be regenerated if the size changes by at least 64 pixels in either dimension. This is useful to avoid unnecessary rendering when the size changes slightly, but you can adjust it to your needs. This is to avoid animations generating a ton of images when the size changes slightly. When rendering an image at the same size for a while, a new image will only be generated regardless of this treshold.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.RenderClosestSizeUntilReady
member.summary: This is used to determine if the SVG renderer should render the closest size available until the texture of the proper size is ready.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.NoShowThreshold
member.summary: How long in seconds between renders should we assume that the image wasn't shown for a while. This will reset how long it's been on screen and delay its generation.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.DisplayTimeBeforeGeneration
member.summary: How long a size that falls within the regeneration threshold should be shown before we generate a specialized image for it. This is used to avoid generating images for sizes that are only shown for a short time while still allowing for images to be generated for sizes that are shown for a longer time.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.Document
member.summary: Gets the SVG document that is used for rendering, measuring, whatever. This will return null when the document is not yet loaded. You can check this periodically if you need to document to be loaded before things happen. Please don't use this to avoid rendering when not ready, this is handled for you.
member.returns: The loaded SVG document, or null if not yet loaded.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.Create(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new SVG renderer from the provided SVG document content.
member.param: The virtual file name to use for identifying this SVG in the texture cache.
The SVG document content as a string.
member.returns: A new SvgRenderer instance.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.Create(System.String,OnixRuntime.Api.Utils.SvgDocument)
member.summary: Creates a new SVG renderer from an already loaded SVG document.
member.param: The virtual file name to use for identifying this SVG in the texture cache.
member.returns: A new SvgRenderer instance.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.CreateFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new SVG renderer that will load the SVG document from the specified file path.
member.param: The file path to the SVG document.
member.returns: A new SvgRenderer instance.

member.summary: Sets the virtual base path used for grouping SVG textures in the texture cache.
member.param: The virtual base path to use.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.WithVirtualFile(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the virtual file name used for identifying this SVG in the texture cache.
member.param: The virtual file name to use.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.WithPathForSize(System.Func{OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Vec2I,OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.TexturePath})
member.summary: Sets a custom function for generating texture paths based on the renderer and size.
member.param: A function that takes the renderer and size, and returns the texture path to use.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.summary: Sets a custom function for rendering the SVG document into raw image data.
member.param: A function that takes the renderer, size, and SVG document, and returns the rendered image data.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.summary: Sets a custom function for transforming the raw size into the actual image size.
member.param: A function that takes the renderer and raw size, and returns the transformed size.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.WithRegenerationThreshold(OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Vec2I)
member.summary: Sets the regeneration threshold for dynamic rendering mode.
member.param: The minimum size difference that will trigger regeneration of the SVG image.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.WithRegenerationThreshold(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the regeneration threshold for dynamic rendering mode using the same value for width and height.
member.param: The minimum size difference that will trigger regeneration of the SVG image.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.WithRegenerationThreshold(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the regeneration threshold for dynamic rendering mode with separate width and height values.
member.param: The minimum width difference that will trigger regeneration.
The minimum height difference that will trigger regeneration.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.WithRenderClosestSizeUntilReady(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether to render the closest available size until the proper size is ready.
member.param: True to render the closest size available, false to wait for the exact size.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.WithNoShowThreshold(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the threshold for how long between renders before assuming the image wasn't shown for a while.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.WithDisplayTimeBeforeGeneration(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets how long a size should be displayed before generating a specialized image for it.
member.param: The time in seconds before generation.
member.returns: This SvgRenderer instance for method chaining.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.RenderStatic(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererCommon,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Rect,System.Single)
member.summary: Renders the SVG in static mode at the specified position with the given opacity. Static mode always generates the perfect size for the render position.
member.param: The position and size to render at.
The opacity to render with (0.0 to 1.0).
member.returns: True if the SVG was rendered, false if it's not ready yet.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.RenderDynamic(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererCommon,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Rect,System.Single)
member.summary: Renders the SVG in dynamic mode at the specified position with the given opacity. Dynamic mode uses intelligent caching and may render approximate sizes until the exact size is ready.
member.param: The position and size to render at.
The opacity to render with (0.0 to 1.0).
member.returns: True if the SVG was rendered, false if it's not ready yet.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.RenderStatic(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererCommon,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Rect,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.ColorF,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Rect)
member.summary: Renders the SVG in static mode at the specified position with the given color tint and UV coordinates. Static mode always generates the perfect size for the render position.
member.param: The position and size to render at.
The UV coordinates for texture sampling.
member.returns: True if the SVG was rendered, false if it's not ready yet.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers.SvgRenderer.RenderDynamic(OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.RendererCommon,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Rect,System.Single,OnixRuntime.Api.Maths.Rect)
member.summary: Renders the SVG in dynamic mode at the specified position with the given opacity and UV coordinates. Dynamic mode uses intelligent caching and may render approximate sizes until the exact size is ready.
member.param: The position and size to render at.
The opacity to render with (0.0 to 1.0).
The UV coordinates for texture sampling.
member.returns: True if the SVG was rendered, false if it's not ready yet.

member.summary: Renders the SVG in dynamic mode at the specified position with the given color tint. Dynamic mode uses intelligent caching and may render approximate sizes until the exact size is ready.
member.param: The position and size to render at.
member.returns: True if the SVG was rendered, false if it's not ready yet.

You should use this one whenever possible since it will properly handle more cases like when you push > matrices. member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.TexturePath.Url(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a texture path from a URL. The image will be downloaded and uploaded for you. In the event that the image cannot be downloaded, it will render a red square. You may unload the texture using which will retry next time. What will happen if the texture is rendered before tells you can be anything from pink, missing texture.
member.returns: The texture path for that texture to use in gfx.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.TexturePath.Url(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Creates a texture path from a URL. The image will be downloaded and uploaded for you. In the event that the image cannot be downloaded, it will render a red square. You may unload the texture using which will retry next time. What will happen if the texture is rendered before tells you can be anything from pink, missing texture.
member.param: The headers to use when downloading the image.
member.returns: The texture path for that texture to use in gfx.

member.summary: The pack manifest will likely be null for sub packs, that's why this is nullable in this version of the struct.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.ResourcePacks.Pack
member.summary: A pack. This is a pack that the user can choose to load. It has a manifest and is likely a main pack. It should always have a manifest so it is non-nullable.

member.name: P:OnixRuntime.Api.ResourcePacks.Pack.Manifest
member.summary: The pack manifest for this pack. This is the main manifest for the pack.

member.name: T:OnixRuntime.Api.ResourcePacks.PackAssetLoader
member.summary: A class used to load files from packs.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.ResourcePacks.PackAssetLoader.HasDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if there is a directory at this path.
member.param: The path to check for a directory.
member.returns: Returns true if the path is a valid directory.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.ResourcePacks.PackAssetLoader.HasFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if there is a file at this path.
member.param: The path of the file to check.
If only trusted content should be read.
member.returns: Returns true if there is a file at this path, could return false if the content is not trusted and trustedContentOnly is true.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.ResourcePacks.PackAssetLoader.GetContentOrNull(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the content of the file at that path. This will return null if the file does not exist or was not trusted. This variant returns null when it cannot load the file that way you can check if the file was read but empty or just not found.
member.param: The file path of the file to get.
If only trusted content should be read.
member.returns: Returns the content or null if it could not be read from.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.ResourcePacks.PackAssetLoader.GetContent(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the content of the file at that path. This will return null if the file does not exist or was not trusted. This variant returns an empty byte array when the file does not exist.
member.param: The file path of the file to get.
If only trusted content should be read.
member.returns: Returns the content or null if it could not be read from.

member.name: M:OnixRuntime.Api.ResourcePacks.PackAssetLoader.GetPathList(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a list of paths in the pack. This will return an empty array if the path does not exist or is not a directory. Note that internally, this will ALWAYS recurse. The difference is that the output will be filtered. So if you plan on recursing, you should not go folder by folder and manually do it.
member.param: The folder to get the files/directories in.
If it should recurse through all the directories.
